website_summaries.verdict: Mid-price model that makes it easy to get up and painting in no time with quality results.
pros: Easy to assemble and use, but there's a learning curve
An HVLP suction gun designed for small to medium-size projects
Handles many materials, including lacquer and chalkboard paint
cons: Occasional leak issues, but customer support is helpful

customer_reviews.title: You're Gonna Love This Sprayer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW! This an awesome finish sprayer. I gladly give it a 5 star. Easy to use, sprays great, easy to clean. Watch my video I made while painting with this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylon Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: No more having to thin paint!!
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is amazing!! So worth the extra $30 over the cheaper Finish Max. No thinning of paint required! Believe me, that is worth the extra $30!! I painted my entire kitchen with milk paint and the finish is flawless. Used this for the poly topcoat as well and topcoating was so fast and easy that I was able to do multiple protective coats. Clean up was easy. I do wish it came with an extra jar so that you could use one to store extra paint and one to run water through the sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Keller

customer_reviews.title: best purchase of the year
customer_reviews.text: This has already paid for itself, best purchase of the year. I saved hours of time, staining deck rails. A job that would take all day, was done in less than an hour. Cleaning the gun takes a little bit of time, but so worth it, when you look at how fast you can knock jobs out. Only caution is that you need to beware of overspray, make sure you tape and drape stuff very well otherwise you will have some extra clean up.
customer_reviews.author: scott lee

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I have painted a lot of projects, walls, molding, furniture, ceilings and cabinets. But this is the first time I’ve used a spray painter. I spray painted some cabinets in my laundry room as part of a renovation. OMG they look like they were just shipped from the factory. Used Behr Ultra premium plus, which in my opinion is the best there is. Hint: spray 3-5 light coats and let dry for as long as possible. Minimum 3 days. Never going back to brushes and rollers again. Excellent spray painter.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Finish only Sprayer
customer_reviews.text: This is a finish only sprayer. It is designed for small projects like part of a chair but in now way should be used for anything bigger than a door due to the extremely low volume (even when thinned properly) and small spray pattern. As an example, i attempted to paint a 6ft by 8 ft section of wooden fence and due to the size it took almost 15 minutes to get a very light coat on the fence. Pros: Light weight Cons: No lock on trigger, Designed for finish work only, Very loud, Very small spray pattern, Very low spray volume
customer_reviews.author: Jed Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cabinets or furniture.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this product to paint cabinets. I really wanted to like this gun. No matter what size tip or pressure that I used it would not atomize paint enough leaving a slightly textured surface. I think this gun would be good for painting a fence or a deck but not furniture or cabinets. I ended up returning the gun and went with a Graco VSP. It is a night and day difference.
customer_reviews.author: Avander1

customer_reviews.title: The spray is not fine like my Graco airless sprayer shoots
customer_reviews.text: I am painting my cabinets using Sherwin Williams paint and the spray quality was too coarse. The spray is not fine like my Graco airless sprayer shoots. I thinned the paint to see if it helped, but got the same results. The gun comes with 3 spray tips and I was using the Red Tip which is for Latex. The primer I used is Pro Base - Latex. The gun sprays good and will most likely work for fences and outside stuff that doesn't need quality like kitchen cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really great! Clean it well!
customer_reviews.text: We love this sprayer, I saw a recommendation for it on a DIY blog for painting kitchen cabinets, and it didn't disappoint. You do have to be diligent about cleaning it right away or the nozzle will get clogged. It really has opened up a world of painting for us. We're going to redo our laundry room cabinets next and also use it to stain our deck. I can't recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: S. Teague

customer_reviews.title: Great for non pros
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a month or so now and have used it several times. Unlike a few of the negative reviews I have had zero issues with it. It works great! Very little overspray and leave an even coat of paint. I've painted 7 doors they look great! My only complaint would be that it doesn't have a screen in the paint holder where the tube is. So you just need to be sure and strain your paint well.
customer_reviews.author: James from AZ

customer_reviews.title: Clean and strain EVERYTIME.
customer_reviews.text: Most problems are user error. Strain your paint! As you can see, a brand new gallon of paint has a lot of garbage that plugs up the sprayer. Use a wrench and pull off the tip and clean inside after every use, as there is build up inside. Trust me, I found out the hard way. Several lighter coats are better than 1 heavy coat, that's what the dial on the trigger is for. Use a respirator and save your lungs from the spray mist.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin A

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: This is the second HomeRight sprayer I've purchased. The first one, though sometimes frustrating, was used on at least twenty projects. Well worth the money. I decided to order a new one as the first was starting to work less consistently. The new one has been a headache from the start. I think it must be defective. When and if I can get it to work it dumps an enormous amount of paint on my projects. I've had to start over twice. I've taken it completely apart and cleaned it multiple times. Having paid $70 for this second one I am super disappointed. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Leahn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product I watched a video how to use it I read the manual! It took way longer using this then painting with a roller! I feel so ripped off and wish I would have not purchased this product! Save your money this product is cheap and doesn’t spray it splatters and paint gets stuck or comes out in blobs even after straining and trying the thinning method.
customer_reviews.author: happymj

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t get the cup to test the paint. The sprayer barely covers any amount of space at all. It took us a million times longer to paint an area than it normally does. Wasted $80 & since I didn’t try it until after amazons return date I can’t return it either. Not happy at all
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with Homeright paint sprayer
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with Homeright paint sprayer. It comes with 3 different size nozzles & had no problem using chalk paint. I love using a spray gun. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Heidelberger

customer_reviews.title: The finish ends up looking horrible and patchy
customer_reviews.text: OK let’s start off by saying this... The home right finish max is a colossal failure. It leaks all over the place. Once in a while it will stop spraying and then you have to figure out why it’s just a lot of work for very little pay off. The finish ends up looking horrible and patchy. It is not a fine spray it is a all over the place spray. I would avoid like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando F.

customer_reviews.title: Broke After First Use
customer_reviews.text: Sprayer stopped spraying after first use. It is not clogged, as it shoots air, it just won't spray paint. Warranty is two years but the process is not good, as I had to call them (during their limited hours) to receive a repair number and I now have to pay to ship it back to them so they can repair it. It worked well while it was working, though.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Clark

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give this zero stars. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. The machine stopped working within 10 mins of using it. I took it to a local shop to look at it and they said the motor burned up/would need replaced. Unfortunately I ordered this in anticipation of painting at our new home and the return window had passed before we got settled and started painting.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sprayer for the price. It took me quite some time to get used to it and to figure out how to get the finish I want, but now I’m pretty happy with it. A few simple recommendations for those who complain about splatters and overspray: 1. Always strain your product to avoid blockage and splattering. 2. Always dilute your product to avoid blockage and splattering. 3. Regulate the flow to avoid overspray. 4. Play with the nozzles and try different nozzles with different products. 5. Get to know your tool and be smart in using it. It’s you who is doing the job, not the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rasa R.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for latex paints. Weak sauce!
customer_reviews.text: Does not compare to airless sprayers. I can’t recommend this for latex paints - the degree you have to thin the paint doesn’t allow for a thick enough coat to provide the desired sheen, and requires multiple coats to achieve one coat with brush or airless sprayer. Takes forever to cover small areas. Clogs easily. Basically a hair blow dryer and a can of paint with a straw. Might work ok for thin paints... not sure I’ll ever use this thing again honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Heather D

customer_reviews.title: easy to apply IF you read the directions
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is top shelf for the DIY'er. We've used it for paint and for Thompson sealer and it does the job. Light, easy to apply IF you read the directions, and of course, I bought it for the Mrs. She's happy, I'm happy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Owner_Operator

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Painter wanted $1200 to paint 500 ft of 7' high block fence (labor only.). Knocked it out in about 5 hours with this. This will pay for itself the first time you use it. Really good consistent spray pattern. Easy to use, Easy cleanup. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sprayer
customer_reviews.text: My contractor would just shake his head every time he came into the garage and saw me painting my kitchen cabinets with a smooth roller and a sponge brush. He suggested an airless sprayer. This model has great reviews so I bought it. Just look at the before and after photos. They speak for themselves. You only need this sprayer, a respirator, eye protection, hood to cover your hair, masking tape, paper, plastic, TSP, liquid sander, sanding blocks and paint. It took me about 90 hours to paint this kitchen. We replaced the hardware then had a carpenter rehang the doors. Now we have a modern kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: kathy Teisinger

customer_reviews.title: Good Spray Gun...Great Price for the Features
customer_reviews.text: I found a recommendation for this paint gun on a DIY website. I'm very happy with it. I haven't tried staining but painting works great. Coverage is good and it's easy to use. I'd suggest looking up some YouTube videos on using this particular gun. I found valuable information there. CONS Cleanup takes longer than I'd like but I think that'll be with any spray gun. There is a tube that will hook to your faucet available on Amazon as well. I might try that to see if it helps. Finding the right paint consistency (thin/thick) was a bit of a challenge for me. Too thin and it runs...too thick and the tip plugs up. Eventually, I figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great for painting Kitchen Cabinets
customer_reviews.text: We spent 3 weeks prepping, sanding, priming and painting our outdated orange oak kitchen cabinets. Using this paint gun was the easiest part. Makes painting go so fast and the finish is excellent. VERY happy with results. They look professionally painted. Note: it did take a bit to get the hang of how to do it, so I practiced using it first on cardboard until I got the hang of it. Definitely worth the $. Only 4 stars because we had a bit of overspray that was hard to control. Also it's a bit loud.
customer_reviews.author: Smith Family

customer_reviews.title: Great for the DIYers
customer_reviews.text: I learned about this sprayer from "The Handyman" on Youtube. If you don't know who he is go check out his channel. This sprayer rocks and once you get the hang of it, it really cuts down on the painting time. The only downside is if you are doing a bigger project it will feel like you are refilling the paint constantly. I may upgrade to their bigger unit in the near future for bigger jobs. Don't let the inexpensive price fool you this is quality and better than anything else at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: JDKansas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SPRAYER
customer_reviews.text: I brought this sprayer last year to stain my deck. I finally got around to doing it this year. This is my first time staining with a solid color. Here are before and after pics of my deck. The sprayer performed like a pro. Its all about the settings. Start with the lowest setting and work your way up to the setting that allows you to cover the item but not saturate it. Everything came out even and smooth. No thinning needed. I used Behr premium weatherproof stain and sealer. This is one coat. I definitely recommend the sprayer. I finished a 6 to 8 hour job in 3 hours and 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great buy I'm subtracting stars because I had to pay ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but I'm subtracting stars because I had to pay (too much) extra to get the absolutely essential rapid cleaning tool, which *should* come in the box. If you plan to use this sprayer a second time, you need that cleaning tool. It consists of a 25 cent hose adapter, a two foot length of PVC hose and two hose clamps--Homeright sells it as an accessory and charges more than $9. That's a rip-off. UPDATE: Just used this unit to spray a table top and I am FLOORED by the quality of the finish. Just floored. OK, I'm adding back a star. This thing does a fantastic job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: First use was good, 10 minutes later, tip clogged and yes I thinned my paint, never could get to spray again even after taking it apart and clean with mineral spirits! Do not purchase! Spend more on a better sprayer, this ain’t the one! Threw in the dump!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use! Easy to Clean!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought HomeRight C800766, C900076 Finish Max HVLP Paint Sprayer. After reading reviews for HOURS, finally decided on this gun. Great choice, It does a really good job. I sprayed my BBQ pit (Rust-Oleum 7778502 Heat Protective Enamel) and sprayed my garage hardy board (Sherwin Williams Latex). Gun is easy to use and easy to clean. It's simple. The directions explained everything I needed to know from start to finish. I had to strain and add water to the latex paint, but there's a cup included with this gun that lets you know the consistency that you'll need for the paint to spray properly. I'd highly recommend purchasing an additional spray container (HomeRight Finish Max Container & Lid).
customer_reviews.author: jeff_prev

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer! Lacquer to Latex
customer_reviews.text: I have used HVLP guns that used a compressor before I could not get consistent results. I read about this unit and decided to give it a try. Wow! Very easy and great results. I will never go back. I just finished spraying a waterborne lacquer with the smallest of the three provided tips. Great results again. I am sure that this $100 sprayer will not last forever in commercial use, but for my occasional use it is great. Easy to clean too. Add 4.28.20 Just finished painting 32' of raw wood cabinets. Finish came out great! Used Cabinet & Trim paint from the big Orange Box store. No thinning, just filter through #60 screen. Excellant results!
customer_reviews.author: Bruno H

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this sprayer months ago and never used it because I was nervous about using it inside, however, yesterday, I finally started on the upstairs and figured that I had nothing to lose since I was going to rip out that ugly carpet anyway. I had a stairwell to paint that I almost considered hiring a pro for because I didn't think that I could get waaaaaay up there painted! I dug out it out, followed the instructions on thinning the paint, and went to work and I got the entire stairwell (to include the ceiling) done in a little over an hour! Clean up was easy and I hate cleaning up after painting!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebbecca

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! Painted my whole barn in 3 hours, I used a strainer every time I refilled, you will be a mess(!), but don't let the name (trim) fool you, this does large jobs wonderfully! My garage is next! Only downside, 2 hours to clean!! -but I am particular about how my tools get put away😉
customer_reviews.author: woges miss

customer_reviews.title: Entry level sprayer does not give you a smooth finish.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this product is amazing for the price that you pay for. It would be great for people who need to do small room renovations and just painting over furniture. The one issue I had is that the entry level paint sprayer in no way gives you a smooth paint finish at all. I had new paint and diluted properly and using the sprayer with the unused filter and when I was spraying I had an eggshell finish compared to the smooth satin finishes that you might want. So if you're looking to find a paint sprayer that gives you a smooth satin finish then this is not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Broke College Student

customer_reviews.title: Infuriated !
customer_reviews.text: Is this some kind of joke. I am beyond, infuriated right now. I just purchased this sprayer to replace my lower model homeright sprayer because it crapped out in the middle of a job I am working on after only a year ...I am needing to put the varnish on asap so I get this in the mail today only to find out this spray gun doesn't include the spray tip needed for varnishes !!!! What???!! So I gotta spend another 20 bucks and wait another few days now ... BS, these sprayers aren't that great to begin with the least they can do is include this important information somewhere other than the instruction manual that comes inside the box!!
customer_reviews.author: sagebaby33

customer_reviews.title: This sprayer is great! Having never used a sprayer before
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is great! Having never used a sprayer before, I was hesitant...but after one use I am planning several paint projects. I stained my outdoor fencing--over 220 feet of 6' tall wood fenced-in under 3 hours. The cleanup was easy too-- actually, easier than cleaning brushes. The ONLY downside is the frequent refilling of the paint cup, but that is completely outweighed by the ease and speed of using this sprayer...plus, I avoided the strain of using a brush or roller. I am very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: John Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sprayer for the price. I had the finish max first and it is a great sprayer for fine finishes. I really had to thin paint to get it to spray. This super has no problem spraying latex. I still thin a little with water but it's probably not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: It's a learning process!
customer_reviews.text: Faced with painting many bifold and cabinet doors during my interior spruce up, I wanted to go an easier and more efficient way of painting them. A little learning curve at first but now I'm a pro, almost! It is especially important to take apart nozzle and immediately after each use. Do not let the paint dry on the inside of unit or you'll probably have problems. I heeded the advice others made in their reviews. I wish I had gotten this sooner before painting other bifold doors by hand. Instructions are easy to understand and operation is easier and easier the more you use it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard G.

customer_reviews.title: HomeRight C800971 HVLP is better than the Wagner. Simply the Best Home Sprayer HVLP Spray Gun!
customer_reviews.text: I own just about every kind of paint sprayer that's ever been made. I've painted houses, boats, airplanes, and many cars. A couple of years ago I purchased a Wagner HVLP paint sprayer and was quite pleased with it. However the HomeRight C800971 HVLP paint sprayer will spray thicker paint and it's much easier to clean. I would recommend getting 150ml Measuring Syringe, greatly reduces waist when transferring paint into the sprayer. I would also recommend getting the Homeright C900097.M Super Finish Max Container and Lid, White and Blue. Just read a few reviews and you'll see why.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for most spraying but not a fine finish
customer_reviews.text: This works well for painting walls. I e also used it for painting doors and furniture. It doesn’t work as great at that. You have to thin the latex paint down a lot to get it to atomized enough that it doesn’t have a ton of orange peel. It will spray undiluted latex no problem it just doesn’t leave a smooth finish. I’m not sure why the regular unit comes with a viscosity cup but this super unit doesn’t so I had to order that separately. It clean up easy expect for the outside of the sprayer itself. It is a fine textured finish and the paint is hard to clean off of that.
customer_reviews.author: James Tewell

customer_reviews.title: Works well for thin materials
customer_reviews.text: Does not spray latex paint, but I use it for polyurethane top coats. I bought the viscosity cup and thinned the latex paint to specifications, but it just splatters. I was using Sherwin Williams latex which is thick. A big box paint like Behr might work because it’s watery to begin with. There are a lot of great reviews but for me, really thin materials are all I use it for. I have to get the Graco out for a latex spray job.
customer_reviews.author: Chad in MN

customer_reviews.title: wish we bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: this is a great sprayer for small and large projects! everything you need comes in the box, is quick and easy to set up and use, and easy to clean! the finish is smooth and even (just keep an eye on the nozzle to wipe off any gunk). we are painting the exterior of our house (and fence panels) and this has saved hours and hours (days!) compared to using a brush - and we love the smooth as glass finish - no brush marks! you can easily customize the spray pattern and it does have good reach when you can't quite reach the high spots! we couldn't be happier with this!
customer_reviews.author: luvingthepnw

customer_reviews.title: Worth all the effort in the end
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time ever using a sprayer, it was a little bit of a learning curve. Used Benjamin Moore Advance in semi gloss. Trick is you DO have to thin it with water. I did not do this at first and I got the dreaded orange peel look. Added 1-2 tbsp water to paint in homeright can and mixed. Might take a while for paint to come thru but try spraying at lowest setting possible, multiple coats will be required. Cleaning took time but worth it for the finished look. Will be doing the rest of my kitchen and hopefully deck as well.
customer_reviews.author: K.A

customer_reviews.title: Worked well one project, not second project - Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Worked well a couple of months ago to paint trim and doors for a room was refinishing. Cleaned thoroughly; used cleaning kit sold by same company. Tried painting swing this weekend; stopped after one pass. Missed amazon return window by 6 days. Needed to finish project so had to go to big box hardware store and buy another one; different model. Seems all brands, different names, belong to Wagner. Update called Wagner to get directions how to return (two year warranty printed on box). Wagner said no refund. Check with Amazon. Buyer beware safer to buy from big box which has more than 30 day return policy. Out $100.
customer_reviews.author: Bracey Mike

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Product of the Year!
customer_reviews.text: The best gift or should I say toy I have ever purchased! I have truly become a painter! I paint everything! My project started with tackling kitchen cabinets and from there everything I see gets updated! The cord needs an extension cord with any project. The best tip I could give is, clean the bottle and gun out after you're finished. LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Schubin

customer_reviews.title: It's a pleasure to paint now
customer_reviews.text: I hate painting. I bought this to paint the shed hoping to avoid spending a day rolling. Wow. I had it all done in an hour. Great investment even for one-two time use. Two suggestions I would make to manufacturers - have a loop with hook for a cord on the handle like leafblowers have. The cord is short and I constantly pulled it from extension. Another is to make a clear vertical strip/window on the container side to better see the paint level.
customer_reviews.author: TSV

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done!
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a paint sprayer and this one got the job done. It was easy to use and the clean up was easy afterwards. Can't wait to use this on my next home project.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Not successful
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I researched the heck out of these and decided on this one. I used Sherwin Williams paint and primer that stated on paint can do not add water. Tried to add water..just floated at top of paint when mixing. So I poured out the water. Water Would not mix in. The sprayer would only shoot out chunks of spray paint even with the smallest add on tip. Would not recommend. Will be throwing away! Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah pompa

customer_reviews.title: Gets clogged constantly!
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money for me! Bought to paint several closet doors with Behr latex paint. It kept getting clogged (I guess) and I had to mess with it every 5 minutes to clear the line. It ended up taking me probably twice as long or more as it would have to just brush paint the doors. Wish I could return, but allowed too much time to pass. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Julieta

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to spray 30 cabinet doors. So far it works pretty well. It did already break on me at the trigger, but I can still use it. It's good for small projects and have only had a few minor ticks with it( make sure your paint consistency is thin enough but not too thin and strain your paint). I believe it also depends on the paint you use. That is the key. It's not heavy and it's easy to use, esp for me being a first time spray user. Not much over spray, which i liked. It does make application go by A LOT faster than brush painting. Overall I am happy with it, esp for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna U.

customer_reviews.title: Finally, Something to Stain my Deck
customer_reviews.text: OK, I must admit it. I'm just getting old and lazy (LOL). Instead of rolling and painting the deck I've been looking for something to make that choir just a little easier. I have a small deck 12 x 14 and have used numerous expensive pump up sprayers that say they will work with deck stains. NO, they don't! I decided to purchase this power painter and it worked. I mean it really works. After reading the directions thoroughly and practicing with the painter I was able to stain my deck without any issues. It was easy to hold and sprays in any direction I hold the sprayer. I should have made the purchase long time again. Excellent Power Pointer....
customer_reviews.author: ABM

customer_reviews.title: Leaks paint everywhere thanks to a cheap gasket. As ...
customer_reviews.text: Leaks paint everywhere thanks to a cheap gasket. As many others have stated, the paint container does not form tight seal and will leak paint all over you when you are spraying. Manufacturer suggests putting vaseline on the gasket. That does help, but does not completely solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Lii

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer in refurbishing and painting! I painted over a red, oversized nightstand, it only took 2 coats of chalk paint, looks 100% professional and has an amazing finish. Never used a paint sprayer before and it was so easy. Make sure you thin your paint to the recommendations. Practice with the water and turning the dial. Definitely don't start out with it on full volume spray, but once you've got it down, it is such a time saver, and the furniture looks so much better than with a paint brush or roller. I don't have any touching up to do, it's just a flawless finish. So, so thrilled with this!!!
customer_reviews.author: JenRN

customer_reviews.title: Really easy and quick
customer_reviews.text: Best investment ever! Forget about using rollers! Saw thing on YouTube and bought it right away. I’ve been using it to paint the interior of my garage and it’s so easy to use and so fast. I used Behr Prime and Paint Ultra White paint in it and did not need any paint thinner - just pour and spray. Doubt spill or leak, didn’t even need to lay out paper or plastic for the floors. It does get a little heavy after a while but I found it helpful using my non dominant arm as a support on the bottom of the sprayer. Cleaning is super easy, took about 5 min at most. Must buy!
customer_reviews.author: David Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Having had a couple other spray painters in the past, I was skeptical about getting another one. At this point, I knew which ones NOT to buy. I read the reviews on this HomeRight spray painter and decided to give it a try. We are painting out basement walls which are limestone. This spray painter worked as advertised. We know how important it is to keep the tip clean and to clean thoroughly between uses. This takes some time and keeping it filled is time consuming as well, but the unit was a pleasant surprise. Very well priced for the quality of job performed. I have already recommended this unit to a couple of my neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Doglady

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait after my project was finished and stained before making a honest review. After running 6 gallons through this spray gun without any issues I definitely would recommend it. Made my job sooooo much easier than brushing and rolling it on. I sprayed, semi transparent redwood stain/sealer/waterproofing from lowes with ease. Used the blue tip with black nozzle, found it was the best coverage and pattern to get into all the hard to reach areas. Only complaint is I wish the spray gun held more material. 1 gallon can fill cup 3-1/4 times not bad but wish it was more capacity.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many different sprayers for polyurethane, and have been disappointed in every one. UNTIL NOW! I got this Saturday, read the manual, and go to work, and the results are amazing. The poly goes on quickly, easily, flows well, comes out smooth and shiny. The gun is easy to fill, easy to use, and even easy to clean. I honestly can't wait to use it again, and am anxious to try it with a Latex paint.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Richards

customer_reviews.title: Easy Clean
customer_reviews.text: This is easiest gun to clean . Sprays will for price I can get nice finish on projects that aren't to large. You have to practice before using on any products. Tip & nozzle size you must have a reference to paint viscosity chart with gun not always right. I use a smaller size most of time time thin paints at times 8-10% max. Worked well on bathroom cabinet & doors great finish i could never get as nice with brush or roller.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it yet. This weekend will be the real test. The sprayer looks impressive and the instruction booklet seems pretty straight forward. I will update this after using this weekend. Finally got around to using the spray gun and I am very impressed. Easy to operate and not one stoppage. Plenty of pressure and puts out an even spray. I tried a cheaper spray gun and had nothing but problems. Not one problem today. After use it is easy to disassemble and clean. All I can say is If you don't have one of these yet you need to get one. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Rod_Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Wow look no further this is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this sprayer. IT ROCKs! I have owned many home sprayers in my time and they all were not as advertised. This one sprays almost professional grade. Sprayed my door in about 10 mins, fine even mist. No sputtering, no clumping, no over spray. Run out cup is great to get thickness correct. Easy to clean! If you are looking for a great priced sprayer for home projects look no further. Out performed my $200 black and decker
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!! Best decision Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg why didn't I buy one of these sooner?!? I took a 5 hr job staining the pool deck lattice and dropped it down to 30 min including the stairs!! After seeing what a fantastic job this did, how easy it was and the over spray wasn't an issue at all... I stained a 40 ft section of fence, both front and back in only an hour! This saved so much time I've raved to everyone, not to mention I don't have a sore shoulder the following day. If you're on the fence... So yourself a favor and buy yourself one of these! For just over $50 you can't beat it!! Best money I've spent in a long time 💵❤️🙌💯
customer_reviews.author: Kit7378

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I think this sprayer is great, but there are lots of things to keep in mind. There is some time in preparing the paint so that it is at the right viscosity. You will need extras containers to be able to do this comfortably. Paint particles get everywhere. You need to protect yourself with a quality mask and the surrounding areas from overspray. Cleanup is a must to make sure the sprayer works next time. If you are working in lots of pieces, get ready to do all this several times in between coats.
customer_reviews.author: Gino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sprayer for the price
customer_reviews.text: We were doing a kitchen cabinet remodel and this was an outstanding value for the money. It does not come with multiple sprayer heads like others, but did the job effortlessly and cleaning was a breeze. I used it to spray Benjamin Moore Advance paint. Had to work out the right balance between too watery and too thick - we arrived at roughly 12% to 15% of water to be added to spray consistently. I also wiped the spray head lightly with a paint thinner every 10 minutes to avoid gumming up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Raghavan

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This gun is garbage. I bought it used and there’s probably a reason why it was sent back the first time also. I used it once and it was just barely OK and I did a wall that was 10 x 10. I cleaned it like a forensic scientist and the next time went to go use it about a week later it would not spray for anything. Complete piece of junk just go to Home Depot and buy one for 150 bucks
customer_reviews.author: sullivan5555

customer_reviews.title: So happy!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this do closets and a pantry. I am not a painter and have never liked doing it. But buying this sprayer made things so much easier and painless. I followed the directions and practiced with water first. Thin your paint! I tried regular paint at first. It sprayed clumpy and messy. Then I thinned it and it was perfect after that. The spray does make a misty mess so mask well. I was covered in paint mist too. I also wore ear protection, goggles, and a resperator. Totally worth it all. Everything looks fresh and clean now.
customer_reviews.author: Niki G.

customer_reviews.title: The Right Spray Tip
customer_reviews.text: I can't leave a rating, seeing that I haven't been able to use it yet. The unit has 6 spray tips for different paints, stains and sealers. It comes with 3. Be sure to check that the tips included match the liquid you are using. I wish I did. I could have started sooner. I just received the tip I need for using wood sealer along with the other 2 that are also not included with the unit. It took 13 days from order, not bad considering. The service at Wagner Spray Tech, where I ordered them from, has a reliable website that I would trust to order again.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Thin you paint. Read instructions
customer_reviews.text: Had my doubts but right out of the box never used one before couple practice swipes and painted my garage door. Without a problem does awsome job. Nice product. Would by again. Thanks for making somthing that works well
customer_reviews.author: KEITH REEVER

customer_reviews.title: Best painting product I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used a sprayer before so maybe I’m really enjoying this sprayer because I’m a first timer. Regardless, the paint looks great. I’ve used it on my kitchen cabinets and they look so smooth. I don’t see clumps or drips. I used the sprayer on a fine setting and did 3 coats. I’ve used it multiple times and I make sure to clean each piece very well between uses. So I think it you keep it cleaned well you will be very happy with the job it does.
customer_reviews.author: Jkmartin

customer_reviews.title: Best sprayer ever.
customer_reviews.text: Love love this little sprayer! Im using high quality latex paint and I do not have to thin the paint or the primer. It is so fun and its super quick to clean. I did order an extra container to clean it with, I fill it with water and paint cleaner and run it through the machine twice after i have sprayed and its pretty much cleaned and remove the parts and wipe them down and im ready to go again. I did my research and it took me 4 months to actually buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: A little too much air pressure for thin finishes.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with oil based rustoleum and vinyl sealer. It worked okay for the rustoleum but not so well with for the sealer. It likely works well for latex which I'll be trying soon. The unit suffers from three problems in my opinion: 1) Too much air for thinner solvent finishes. This causes large amounts of overspray and finish problems. 2) As some others have stated,it's difficult to clean. Finish/paint in the suction tube can be difficult to remove. The provided tube brush isn't long enough to clean the whole tube. 3) The design with the motor on to makes it difficult to get into tight spaces such as the inside of cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Stan V.

customer_reviews.title: I painted the entire outside of my house with it!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, that's right. I know it's a "finisher", but I hate painting, especially stucco. Our house is about 1700 square feet with a second story. I did have to water down the paint and it did get clogged, like all sprayers do. I found if I put my finger over the the nozzle and let it build up pressure, it would spray better. I was more concerned about the motor going out, but it didn't. I finished the house up and cleaned it out really good. I definitely got my money out of it. However, I think I'm just going to keep it for stains and thinner liquids.
customer_reviews.author: AGB

customer_reviews.title: Great power sprayer, just make sure you tape everything!
customer_reviews.text: Used it to paint my dining room a dark blue. The paint sprayer was super even and easy to use; however, it got all over the ceiling. I taped off probably 6" on the ceiling but it still got all over the ceiling which then had to be painted. I'd recommend either holding a large piece of cardboard above to make sure that doesn't happen or just painting items outside in a tent. I haven't had a chance to use on furniture yet but am super excited as it's really powerful. Just make sure you cover the ceiling as the spray goes everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Wen

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Bang for the buck. Works better than I thought and leaves a beautiful finish with no brush strokes. One thing to note: I used latex paint and you will most likely need to thin it out, to do this all you need is water. If your using oil paint you must purchase some type of paint thinner. I've painted window trim, folding doors, walls. It cuts my paint time more than half. Clean up is easy, just add little soapy water (if latex paint is used) .
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Good For Job
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to stain a large section of fence. Did the job well. Had some infrequent jamming that required breaking down the nozzle assembly and cleaning out. Small stain/paint capacity but worked around it with an extra container and a helper who kept me loaded. Otherwise you wind up taking a couple of minutes reloading paint. Cleanup was also a pain but I've had worse cleanup jobs with Wagner in past. Practice helped. Took care of a lot of work and overall was a great value for the price. Interested in trying indoors.
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Herrity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: After installing the red nozzle for latex paint, I thinned the paint with 15% water only, and proceeded to easily spray 840 square feet of vertical steel wall surface in 5 hours including a thorough cleanup of the gun after I finished. I had never sprayed latex before, but this was a simple process with this HVLP gun. I would not hesitate to buy another one, although this one should last forever. Not even a hesitation from this gun in 4 hours of continuous spraying! 2 full gallons of Sherwin Williams exterior paint was used. Thinned only, with no strainer used.
customer_reviews.author: TOM47

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recent kitchen remodel, Knowing that I was needing to paint all the woodwork, trim, doors and some cabinetry I wanted a smooth brush stroke free finish. The super finish max did a great job! I never had a clog or malfunction . I used a PPG paint called breakthrough which sprayed beautifully without thinning using the green tip. The finish applied to new wainscoting panels and moulding looks like a factory applied finish. Clean up is not too bad but very important to get it clean! the tip sets are brass and the turbine seems pretty powerful. Overall I'm pleased with it and look forward to using it more
customer_reviews.author: Mendy Lambdin

customer_reviews.title: Can spray Kilz.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed that this gun can spray undiluted Kilz. This primer is the consistency of mustard or mayo and barely can pour. The gun with the largest tip (included) worked pretty well. I spent the first hour with the machine learning how to use it, then another hour learning to be proficient and then painted 5 gallons of Kilz on fresh sheetrock. Cleanup is involved but easy since everything comes apart. If I had to do a smaller area, I'd go with a roller and brush but for the large garage I'm painting, the spray gun is easier, faster and more consistent.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine recommended it and Im glad that I listened. I had bought a different one before and it became defective. So I bought this one and it didn’t disappoint. Make sure you use thinner in ur paint... the manual tells u how thin it should be. I finished painting my fence in record time once I was ready to go. Looking forward to my next projects.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Hocker

customer_reviews.title: Never paint with a brush again !!!
customer_reviews.text: Me and my husband love love love this sprayer! So far we have done our shutters, front and back doors, kitchen cupboards, and hallway. Literally less than half the time for application oppose to painting with a brush. We used slices of cardboard boxes when doing our kitchen cupboards and it worked seamlessly as long as your careful. With edging and thin edges on any objects the vertical setting is ideal, then switch to horizontal for wider coverage through the middle regions.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a paint sprayer so I could spray my plantation shutters. I didn’t want to spend a lot so I decided to try this one. I was skeptical at first because some of the other paint sprayers were so much more expensive and usually you get what you pay for. But I’ve sprayed two sets of shutters so far about 8 individual shutters and I couldn’t be happier. I find that it’s better when you add a little water to the paint. You don’t have to add a lot but I find it helps a little. Overall very happy with this product 😀
customer_reviews.author: Mom2

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old piston sprayers
customer_reviews.text: Being an old guy I was surprised by the function of the sprayer. Remember the old vibrating piston units of years got past? Not any more. This unit operates on air flow versus pumping as the older units did. I sprayed 3 quarts of Rustolium through it thinned at 5%. Worked just fine no vibrating noisy gun. I wouldn't paint a car with it but for a diy project it works fine. As for cleaning.....same old story same basic procedure, not a fun job but better than a sore toe.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a less expensive one and ended up returning it and buying this one. Easy to use, easy to clean and sprays a nice even "light" spray after backing the adjustment know out/counterclockwise about halfway. Putting two light coats does the trick Sprayed all my cabinet doors and drawers with 2 quarts thinned with water to the recommended flow rate. Also, when thinning with water, found that sometimes the tap water makes it yellowish, so using bottled or distilled water might be a better choice. All in all, love this sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: George T.

customer_reviews.title: Great sprayer..
customer_reviews.text: Herd alot of bad reviews about this sprayer, decied to buy it for a paint project and was very surprised at how well it did. I did buy a special paint that didn't need thinned however when I tried unthinned paint it was a little more difficult. Cleaning was a little on the tricky side. I washed it out a couple times after each use then filled with hot water and sprayed it into a bucket to clean the nozzles. Takes a little bit of time but I wouldn't want it to sit for any length of time with paint in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer specifically for applying Minwax Polycrylic and I can honestly say the first time I used it I got the best finish I’ve ever been able to do...and I’m a serious woodworking hobbyist. No more foam brushes for me. This sprayer is an absolute game changer. ADDITIONAL TIP: If you’ll be using water based product in your sprayer go ahead and spend the extra $20 for the Rapid Clean cleaning kit specifically designed for this sprayer, it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a couple light home projects and it's the old adage of you get what you pay for. I tried to use it and it just spits out globs of paint, even after sufficiently thinning with water per paint manufacturer's instructions, which is what the sprayer instructions advise. I followed the directions for the type of surface I was painting and spray I wanted. I tried several times, even adding more water to try to get the spray consistency smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Williams

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer was a waste of money. Do not buy this sprayer. We bought it for spraying cabinets and a large bookcase as well as some lawn furniture. It is easy to use. With that being said, it’s useless. The paint that comes out is not consistent flow. The little brass tip where the paint comes out gets clogged with paint that some how drys...even though it was being used and not sitting. I tried to use it a second time, you know give it one more chance. Same result and then the trigger area started to break. So after two uses I was unable to finished either job I stated with the sprayer and now broken.
customer_reviews.author: Cup

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This was a real time saver and easy to use. I painted a large Ceder fence and it performed flawlessly. I made sure to thin the paint(latex) to 40 seconds with viscosity cup that is included withe the sprayer. Easy to take apart and clean too. I will definitely use this on many more painting projects in the future. Update: After owning this now for a few years, it has been one of my best investments, have painted kitchen and bathroom cabinets, plantation shutters, doors and shelving and it perform flawlessly. Great spray gun
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sprayer with smooth finish!
customer_reviews.text: I have been truly amazed at the spray quality of this Sprayer. DIY guy. Have sprayed inside house doors, one full vanity, a console which is being converted and have one vanity to go. Less paint is more and finish smooth as silk. Friends cant believe things didnt come from factory. Very pleased. Bought extra nozzle set as outdoor paint for fence had a thicker consistency but white picket fence looks great. Took neighbor 2 days by hand to paint his. Mine was 4.5 hrs over two days as sprayed two coats. Very pleased indeeed!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean, clogs easily!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use.. and works great to paint. A bit daunting to get the paint mixture correct with the flow tool.. time consuming.. but once you have viscosity correct, it works! Problem is.. It clogs very easily.. we have been cleaning well.. MUST MAKE SURE to STRAIN paint prior to using. If a small dried paint particle gets inside.. it is very hard to clean it out. I bought the special cleaning tool... but can only fit over our garden hose! Does not help much.
customer_reviews.author: pamela6000

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: Great little spray gun for the price! Recently shot five gallons of stain/sealer on some cedar posts and beams on a high end home for one of my customers. Lots of masonry surrounding the posts, so having the ability to dial in the spray pattern was a must! The gun performed great and my customers were more than pleased! Also shot a couple gallons of paint on some trim, and that turned out great as well! It’s already paid for itself several times over in just one customer!
customer_reviews.author: S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Spray it all over the place...it's kinda fun
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad sprayer. We've used it for a few projects now. providing you clean it, thin the paint properly AND you strain the paint through some form of filter, it works. On our second project, we didn't strain the paint and it immediately gummed up. Had to take the whole thing apart and clean and start over again (about a 20-25 minute process). When it is working the spray is even and controllable. Surprisingly little over spray and good one pass coverage (using Benjamin Moore all in paint and primer). Worth checking out for home owner/occasional user
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S. Kato

customer_reviews.title: Great for Painting Cabinets
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this paint sprayer in order to paint our kitchen cabinets. We ended up rolling/brushing the paint on the frame of the cabinets. We sprayed the doors. I am so glad we purchased this spray gun. The sprayed doors look phenomenal. We should have bought one of the years ago. Clean up was much simpler than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Fence Painting - Exterior Latex Paint
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to paint my wood privacy fence, since the wood was getting a little gray looking. This sprayer allows me to apply a thick coat of exterior latex paint so I do not have to do a second coat. I have ran about 5 gal of paint through it so far, and still working great and the fence looks good. The cleaning is a bit tedious, but that is usually the case with cleaning painting tools. Recommend for outdoor paints (have not tried painting indoors with it yet, but I will someday).
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Overall Excellent FINISHING Paint Sprayer for Small Projects
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer to paint interior walls and trim but quickly found this is NOT a large project sprayer. That said, after some testing, I was better able to both control the spray flow/patterns and keep the nozzle clear of clogs (which happens easily/frequently) for small project work of refinishing kitchen cabinets. As paint guns go, this one was one of the better ones I've used. Lightweight, good focus on small areas.
customer_reviews.author: ActiveShopperGal

customer_reviews.title: Do your work and the sprayer will do it’s
customer_reviews.text: I refinished my kitchen cabinets, went from dark to whit and gray. Sprayer worked great, practice with it first to dial it into the paint your using. One thing I would say is do the proper prep work and use a quality paint. ( I used Advance from BM) Clean, sand lightly, prime and paint. Then sand lightly again and paint again. I did two coats on cabinets and three on the doors and they look like fantastic!! Like they came from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: W. McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Great product and did the job well
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical buying this particular item knowing the big brand names out there. Many reviewers have stated to dilute the paint, stain or whatnot. I used a mid range outdoor latex from Pittsburg paints. No diluting at all. Just make sure to get the flow control right. This sprayer did the job and I was very pleased with the turnout. The only issue I had was the trigger that came with it. It always came off and is difficult to put back on. I used it for about 6-7 hours for two days back to back without the trigger and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Moore

customer_reviews.title: Why did I take so long to buy this
customer_reviews.text: I have used this multiple times to paint every room in my 3500 square foot house over the past month. This is very easy to use and provides great coverage! I have not had any leaking or other issues other people reported. I usually spend more time cleaning it than I do painting and I think that’s why it’s holding up so well. I highly recommend this but just know it will take a while to clean it well but it’s totally worth it! Everyone in my family is getting one of these for Christmas now! It’s really saved me time and looks great
customer_reviews.author: jenni

customer_reviews.title: Great value but needs to have velocity cup included
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with chalk paint on a some kitchen table chairs with spindles. Worked perfect, easy set up and breezed through painting them in a fraction of the time versus hand painting them. It also worked great with the polyacrylic I used. However I’m taking off one star as it should have had a velocity cup included for the price and I had to order that separately. This is not a heavy duty product for professionals but works great for those who do chalk paint projects or would like to try a sprayer that does not need an air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: One cat away from crazy

customer_reviews.title: Love this sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for over 6 months, for many many projects, & has yet to disappoint. Ive used oil base paint, water based paint & even chalk paint, & each time, it produced great results! It just takes some tinkering figuring out the dilution that works best for each paint, but once you get the hang of it, its a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Country Life

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sprayer for this beginner
customer_reviews.text: I disassembled my security door to clean and repaint the steel mesh that my dog had scratched up. Overtime it had rusted and looked awful. I knew the only way to get a good finish would be spraying but I had never done it before. I was scared. I read the directions carefully (I strongly recommend this step) and did a test spray on a cardboard box to build my confidence. I painted my door and I must say it looks great! I am a 75-year-old woman. If I can handle this paint sprayer I think anyone can. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: Professional finish!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing project. Used it on my kitchen cabinets along with sherwin Williams bonding primer followed by sherwin Williams urethane paint. amazing results looks like factory finish!!! Need to thin paint with water to get the right viscosity - practice first before diving into project. I don’t write reviews often but this product deserves one!! Easy to clean and operate :)
customer_reviews.author: renee falcioni

product_meta.title: HomeRight C800766, C900076 Power Painter, Home Sprayer Tool, HVLP Spray Gun for Painting Projects, Finish Max
product_meta.description: The HomeRight Finish Max paint sprayer is great for beginners and experts alike when painting and refinishing furniture, kitchen cabinets, trim, and more! This versatile sprayer applies a smooth finish and can be used with chalk and milk paint, latex paints, enamels, primers, clear sealer, polyurethane, stain and varnish. The Finish Max uses High Volume, Low Pressure (HVLP) technology and it has a turbine motor, which means that a separate air compressor isn’t needed! The Finish Max has three adjustable spray patterns (horizontal, vertical, round) and an adjustable flow control knob for more project versatility. Plus it can hold 27 ounces of paint, which means less refilling when working on larger projects. The unit is lightweight at only 2. 76 lbs, which reduces hand fatigue when painting or staining projects. The Finish Max comes with an air nozzle, cleaning brush, and viscosity cup.
feature_bullets: BETTER THAN A BRUSH OR SPRAY CAN: The HomeRight Finish Max paint sprayer is an easy-to-use electric paint sprayer that applies a smooth finish without brush marks. It’s the best paint sprayer option for painting furniture, cabinets, trim, and more

ADJUSTABLE SETTINGS, EASY TO USE: The paint spray gun features easy adjustable settings to help complete your project. You can adjust the air cap to spray horizontal, vertical, and round. You can also adjust the material flow control knob to quickly increase or decrease the material output, which allows you to customize your paint flow to your project/coating needs

EASY TO SPRAY AND CLEAN: The Finish Max is simple to set up and can be used to spray a wide variety of materials such as chalk type paint, milk paint, latex paints, enamels, primers, clear sealer, polyurethane, stain and varnish. It also comes with a viscosity cup to easily measure paint thickness. When you’re done with your project, simply clean the sprayer with water for water based materials or mineral spirits for oil based. The sprayer also comes with a useful cleaning brush to make clean-up quicker

BRASS SPRAY TIP TECHNOLOGY: The HomeRight Finish Max paint sprayer uses a 2 mm. precision brass spray tip and nozzle, which provide superior performance over plastic counterparts. As opposed to plastic, the Finish Max brass nozzles and tips provide a consistent, high quality spray pattern and have superior corrosion and wear resistances

U.S. BASED CUSTOMER SERVICE AND 2 YEAR WARRANTY: If you have any questions about your sprayer, please call our U.S based customer service team for quick and efficient assistance. We’re proud of our products, which is why the Finish Max is backed by a 2 year warranty

specifications.Included Components: Finish Max, 27 oz. Viscosity Cup, Air Blow Nozzle, Cleaning Brush
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,655 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
